messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:42): what happens if you have  "english HEBREW HEBREW HEBREW english" and the HEBREW part is so long it splits into three lines?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:43): Or, wait, is that logical or visual string order that you specified?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:45): If the logical text was "e1 H1 H2 H3 e2", presumably it would be displayed as "e1 H3 \n H2 \n H1 e2".

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:46): Since linebreaking should be more-or-less a visual effect where you just break lineboxes, and if the text fit on one line it would display as "e1 H3 H2 H1 e2".
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:49): Which part is crazy?  The one-line layout, or how it's broken into lineboxes?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:49): the part where you have to start reading by skipping a line and then reading up
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:49): Man, I dunno.  You shouldn't mix text directions in a single inline layout anyway.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:50): you don't have much choice when writing hebrew
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:50): e.g. THE POPE SAID "whatever the pope said" WHICH IS SILLY
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:50): if the quote is long, it'll split across many lines
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:50): but you want the start of the quote to be on the first line
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (02:51): Solution: stop being rtl, or switch everyone to rtl.
